intro: Polygonella fimbriata var. robusta, commonly known as the robust polygonella, is a perennial grass-like plant native to North America. It typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as streambanks and wet meadows. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, clustered spikes of greenish or reddish flowers. It is a member of the Juncaceae family, which includes various species of rushes and sedges. This variety is distinguished by its robust growth and thick, fimbriated (fringed) leaf margins.
